channel.title: Need some help with ip adress or something
channel.description:
@ how to make a server it says this:
For ip address fill in your default gateway.
but when i do this a wanna save this settings it says: The ip adress of the DHCP-server is the same as the ip adress of the DHCP client.
how to fix this?
please some1 help

item.title: Need some help with ip adress or something
item.dc:creator: @rickske rickske
item.description:
@rickske wrote:

blain sorry but this is my topic.
hope you will understand that maybe you can make your own? thankyou

If you closed your cmd box reopen it and put in ‘ipconfig’ again and put in the last digits in that box. ie: xx.xx.xxx.72
You would put in the 72. Just an example
Put in the ports you want open and enable and save.

and i dont understand this?
i know to open cmd and did put in ipconfig but then i dont know how to do the rest.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 17, 2008, 03:04:58 pm[/size][hr]also none of the number are the same at this:

from how to make a server topic.

mine:

does this matter?

sorry for that its german.
i wanna change it to but dont know how:P[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 17, 2008, 04:26:10 pm[/size][hr]some1 else can help me out pls?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 17, 2008, 04:42:19 pm[/size][hr].[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 17, 2008, 04:51:58 pm[/size][hr]grr i still cant log in on my server please some1 help[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 17, 2008, 04:52:23 pm[/size][hr].[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 17, 2008, 06:34:49 pm[/size][hr][quote=“508_Client, post:6, topic:237097”]Do ‘ipconfig’ in a cmd box. Put the ‘gateway’ into your browser. Log into your router and go to applications blah blah blah.
For the IP adress: If you closed your cmd box reopen it and put in ‘ipconfig’ again and put in the last digits in that box. ie: xx.xx.xxx.72
You would put in the 72. Just an example
Put in the ports you want open and enable and save.

www.portforward.com has way better guides that go indeph.

Your compiler is out of date. I’ll post one in a minute, could you tell me your JDK version?[/quote]

give me the link pls.

Read full topic

ok that worked

ip: 192.168.1.100

item.title: Need some help with ip adress or something
item.dc:creator: @508_Client 508_Client
item.description:
@508_Client wrote:

There are a few things that may cause the MS-DOS not to work. Try this.

Go to your Environment Variables->System variables and locate “PATH”. Add C:\windows\system32 at the
end if it is not already there.

Read full topic

item.description:
@508_Client wrote:

[quote=“Blain2007, post:7, topic:237097”]Also @ 508 client, im havin trouble port fowarding my no-ip, my main problem is i cant use my cmd prompter becuase of a virus on my comp, it wont let me do ipconfig in cmd
just says isnt recognized as an internal or external command[/quote]

That type of behavior more than likely due to a misconfigured path environmental variable.

cd C:\windows\System32\

item.source: Need some help with ip adress or something

item.title: Need some help with ip adress or something
item.dc:creator: @Blain2007 Blain2007
item.description:
@Blain2007 wrote:

Right click your compiler, press edit, delete all the words in it

and paste this into it and save

@echo off title Server Compiler. "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java title Server Compiled. echo Compiled. pause
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 17, 2008, 01:02:28 pm[/size][hr]Also @ 508 client, im havin trouble port fowarding my no-ip, my main problem is i cant use my cmd prompter becuase of a virus on my comp, it wont let me do ipconfig in cmd
just says isnt recognized as an internal or external command

Read full topic
item.source: Need some help with ip adress or something

item.title: Need some help with ip adress or something
item.dc:creator: @508_Client 508_Client
item.description:
@508_Client wrote:

Do ‘ipconfig’ in a cmd box. Put the ‘gateway’ into your browser. Log into your router and go to applications blah blah blah.
For the IP adress: If you closed your cmd box reopen it and put in ‘ipconfig’ again and put in the last digits in that box. ie: xx.xx.xxx.72
You would put in the 72. Just an example
Put in the ports you want open and enable and save.

www.portforward.com has way better guides that go indeph.

Your compiler is out of date. I’ll post one in a minute, could you tell me your JDK version?

Read full topic
item.source: Need some help with ip adress or something

item.title: Need some help with ip adress or something
item.dc:creator: @rickske rickske
item.description:
@rickske wrote:

in my compile is also this:

@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

i need JDK 6 update 6 i think?
but in the make a server topic stands that you also could change the number at classpath and path.

some1 can tell me what to do?

Read full topic
